title: Open counter for italic b
content:
Hello Typophiles,  
Does anyone know any fonts with an italic b with an open bowl like this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090827073213im_/http:/typophile.com/files/eternalitalicopenb_4511.gif)
  
I can’t quite get mine to work and need a bit of inspiration!
author: Bendy

comments.content: Not sure if Roman examples will be of use, but Martin Majoor has an open “b” in Scala and Nexus serif. Unfortunately, he closes it for the italics.

I was thinking of Scala too, and [Fedra](http://web.archive.org/web/20090827073213/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/fedra_serif_a). Interestingly, both these are open in the roman and closed in the italics. I wonder what the logic behind that is.
I would just close it. Your other letters are lovely.

Aww, hm. That could be the way to go. It perhaps draws too much attention.

\>lovely  
Thanks, it’ll appear in the crit section shortly. Or not so shortly, depending on how long the caps and numerals take to rein in.
